destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead you quickly salvage what you can.

event.text: You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.

textList.name: TEXT_STORE_REBEL_HOSTILE
textList.text: The source of the distress beacon appears to be a small market under attack from a Rebel!
A merchant ship here is under attack from Rebels. They're helpless against them and you may be their only chance at survival.
A Rebel ship is assaulting a small black market. Perhaps if you can rescue them they'll sell to you.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

event.text: You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.

textList.name: TEXT_STORE_AUTO_HOSTILE
textList.text: An automated Rebel vessel has opened fire on a small marketplace, presumably because they were dealing to Feds!
You receive a distress call from a small trading outpost. "Help! Our automated ship has gone haywire and is attacking us!"
You notice a black market under fire from an Auto-ship nearby. Looks like even the Rebels aren't pleased with pirates.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead you quickly salvage what you can.

event.text: You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.

textList.name: TEXT_STORE_PIRATE_HOSTILE
textList.text: The distress beacon appears to be originating from a small, civilian-run market under attack from pirates!

Pirates don't always get along well with each other, and the scene at this beacon is evident. A hostile pirate ship is firing on another pirate station. The station's fate looks bleak unless you step in.
You notice a Federation merchant vessel being blockaded by pirates. This must be the source of the distress beacon.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead you quickly salvage what you can.

event.text: You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.

textList.name: TEXT_STORE_MANTIS_HOSTILE
textList.text: A Mantis appears to have decided to prey on a nearby unarmed merchant vessel. While you don't find it particularly intelligent to travel into mantis space without weapons, they're still civilians and they won't last long.
It appears a Mantis and a smuggler are duelling it out at this beacon, arguing over prices.
A Mantis is firing at a small Engi merchant trying to get out of the sector. It's not likely the Engi will last long.

event.name: STORE_HOSTILE_WIN
event.text: You have rescued the store from their attackers. The store owners offer to trade.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_NOTHING
event.text: If you desire, you have some time to do something on the ship before going to the store.

textList.name: TEXT_EVENT_STORE_SLAVES
textList.text: You spot a well known slave trader nearby, advertising several decently priced slaves.
A slaver nearby, also shopping, appears to be stocking up on "labourers" from another pirate vessel. You could likely purchase some from them as well.
A small slaver clan hails you, offering slaves in change for scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_EVENT_STORE_CIVILIAN_FUEL
textList.text: A civilian vessel rests at the store, making small modifications to their ship. They hail you requesting to purchase some fuel.
A civilian ship jumps in not long after, their engines leaking rapidly. They could probably use some fuel.

choice.text: Give them the crate of fuel.

event.text: "Wow, that's a big box of fuel! Thank you so much!"

textList.name: TEXT_EVENT_STORE_ENGI_PARTS
textList.text: An Engi vessel is docked nearby. They hail you, requesting to purchase additional droneparts.
It appears you have caught the attention of an Engi captain. "Request: we will purchase excess drone parts. Scrap will be given in return."

choice.text: Give them the crate of parts.

event.text: "High amount of droneparts... satisfactory. Requires: alternative payment. Hull drones will be dispatched."

textList.name: TEXT_EVENT_STORE_ROCK_AMMO
textList.text: A Rock ship pilots in nearby, their missiles offline. It's likely they've run out of ammunition.
A burly Rock captain hails you. "Captain! We are in need of ammunition. Can you spare some? We will pay."

choice.text: Give them the crate of ammo.

event.text: The Rockmen are pleased by your large donation. They transfer over a generous amount of scrap and fuel.

textList.name: TEXT_EVENT_STORE_CRATES
textList.text: A couple merchants are busy offloading some large crates of supplies. You could likely buy some off of them if you wanted.
You're hailed by an honest merchant who offers some large crates of supplies.

choice.text: Buy a crate of fuel. [15 scrap]
Buy a crate of missiles. [30 scrap]
Buy a crate of droneparts. [40 scrap]

event.name: EVENT_STORE_ORCHID_KERNEL
event.text: An Orchid military vessel is docked nearby, in need of some repairs. They appear to be offering one of their special Kernel weapons in return for scrap.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_CRYSTAL_WEAPON
event.text: A Crystal merchant is taking a rest nearby. They spot you and offer a crystalline weapon hand-crafted by their people.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_VAGABOND_WEAPON
event.text: A beaten Ghost vessel lingers nearby, peddling weapons of dubious quality. Their prices seem reasonably cheap...

event.name: EVENT_STORE_ZOLTAN_REACTOR
event.text: A Zoltan science vessel roams around nearby the store. They advertise reactor upgrades.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_BEGGAR
event.text: A Monk ship hails you. "Oh please, good captain, could you spare just a small amount of scrap so that we may feed ourselves?"

choice.text: Give them a very small amount of scrap.

event.text: The Monk glares at you for being so stingy, but says nothing more.

choice.text: Give them a generous amount of scrap.

event.text: The Monk scoops up the scrap metal, smiling wide at you.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_BEGGAR_REWARD
event.text: As you walk away from the Monk you feel lighter in your step. You feel really lucky, as if nothing could go wrong.

textList.name: TEXT_EVENT_STORE_INN
textList.text: A small inn has been established here. A table of mercenaries drinks and tells tales of their previous adventures. You could likely hire one of them if you have the scrap for it.
A band of miscellaneous crew stand on a podium showing off their abilities, hoping someone will hire their service for scrap.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_MERCENARY_FLEET
event.text: A sleazy Mercenary captain hails you. "You look like a fellow that could use some help with the fleet..."

choice.text: Hire them to delay the fleet.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_REBEL_CHOICE
event.text: A Rebel ship is resting nearby, making some minor repairs on their hull. They don't seem to notice you.

choice.text: Take this chance to attack them!

event.text: You'll give these Rebels hell simply cause you can. You power up the weapons and approach.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_PIRATE_SKETCHY_REACTOR
event.text: A grinning pirate captain hails you. "Your ship seems to be running pretty well, but everyone can use a little extra bit of power, right?"

choice.text: Buy a reactor upgrade from them.

event.text: You hand over the scrap to the pirates.
The pirates go to work on your reactor, but they turn out to not be as experienced as you thought and end up damaging your reactor instead! They half-heartedly apologize and offer a partial refund.
The pirates do good work on your reactor and it runs at even higher efficiency than before.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_PIRATE_SKETCHY_REPAIRS
event.text: A grinning pirate captain hails you. "Your ship seems to be running pretty well, but looks like you could use some repairs, eh?"
You hand over the scrap to the pirates.
The pirates go to work on your hull, but they aren't very good at their job. Though they do make some good work, they accidentally open a couple breaches. They apologize but refuse a refund.
The pirates do good work on your hull.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_MANTIS_SLAVES
event.text: A Mantis ship boasting a team of Engi slaves is shopping nearby. If you have the scrap, you might be able to buy one of their slaves off of them.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_MAP
event.text: You're hailed by a civilian vessel. "Hello captain! We have been travelling this sector and have created detailed mappings of the locations. Would you care to purchase some?"

event.name: EVENT_STORE_MINELAUNCHER
event.text: A looping advertisement from the store markets minelaunchers at incredibly cheap prices. Seems they're trying desperately to get rid of them.

event.name: EVENT_STORE_AUTO_REPAIRS
event.text: An automated support vessel is offering repairs in return for scrap. Despite being of Rebel design it seems open to serving anyone willing to pay.
The store owners oblige and pay you some scrap.

event.name: UNAVAILABLE_TAX
event.text: HOW DID YOU GET THIS???

textList.name: TEXT_STORES
textList.text: A ship engineer has set up a small shop here.
You find yourself surrounded by a group of mysterious alien vessels. They hail you and apparently have some valuable technology for sale.
A transmission from the nearby planet indicates an outpost below which offers supplies to travelers. You send down an away party to check it out.
The space station here has a traveling merchant who shows you his wares.

There is only one other ship at this beacon, and it is showing heavy damage. You receive a message on your console: "Greetings traveler. We were crippled by a band of pirates and are now forced to sell our remaining valuable equipment to acquire the necessary supplies to get home."
A couple alien vessels are waiting here, but none disturb you. It appear there is a store at this beacon.
A friendly merchant greats you at this beacon, and you strike up a trade.

textList.name: EMPTY
textList.text: Your jump leads you to nothing but empty space. This Jump Beacon serves no purpose other than as a connection.
You jump into an unremarkable system. No life signs detected within scanning range.
Your scans reveal a mining base on a nearby planet long since abandoned. No life signs detected.
Your scans reveal an ore refinery and several factories, all standing still and empty. No life signs detected.
You discover a nearby planet speckled with settlements, although none respond to your hails.
This beacon has been built for a nearby civilian space-station. No one hails your ship.

The nearby planet shows sign of habitation and great beauty. A rudimentary automated planetary defense system is looping its message into space: "Warning! Quarantine Level 5 in effect under FHA Act 22, article 11.2. Warning! Quarantine Level 5..."
Your jump leads to a completely unremarkable binary star system. There is nothing else around.
Your jump leads to a remarkable binary star system. The view is beautiful, but there is nothing else around.

textList.name: TEXT_EMPTY_START
textList.text: Your computer is flooded by a number of alerts informing you this beacon is unstable from repeated use. Despite this, you have little worry because of your Multiverse drive, so you take this opportunity to do something aboard the ship.
This sector is still under heavy construction to make way for supply depots and Multiverse warp-bays. This beacon has not yet undergone industrialization, and is empty as far as you can see.
A small planet is in orbit nearby, spotted with settlements. However, the beacon has nothing else to offer than the view.
An automated Federation vessel is scouting out the nearby system.

event.name: BOSS_STORES
event.text: Despite the utter chaos going on in this sector, the Federation fleet appears to have quarantined off this system, and are selling supplies to passing Federation ships..
"You need supplies? Certainly, no need for that license. You need everything you can before that flagship."

textList.name: STORES_COREWORLDS
textList.text: A ship engineer has set up a small shop here.
You find yourself surrounded by a group of mysterious alien vessels. They hail you and apparently have some valuable technology for sale.
A transmission from the nearby planet indicates an outpost below which offers supplies to travelers. You send down an away party to check it out.
The space station here has a traveling merchant who shows you his wares.

There is only one other ship at this beacon, and it is showing heavy damage. You receive a message on your console: "Greetings traveler. We were crippled by a band of pirates and are now forced to sell our remaining valuable equipment to acquire the necessary supplies to get home."
A couple alien vessels are waiting here, but none disturb you. It appear there is a store at this beacon.
A friendly merchant greats you at this beacon, and you strike up a trade..

textList.name: EMPTY_COREWORLDS
textList.text: A small Civilian settlement is nearby, well protected by Militia patrols. You don't bother trying to contact the settlement.
Despite all the civilian infrastructure in this sector, this beacon appears to be mostly empty.
No pirates, politicians, or people of any kind populate this place.
This beacon offers a break from the busy happenings of the civilians in this sector.
For once, a beacon where you aren't having to save a civilian from a pirate ship. You relax and do something on the ship.
A heavily protected Militia caravan is passing through this beacon. They won't respond to your hails, and attacking them would be practically suicide. You lay low and do something on the ship.

textList.name: STORES_MILITIA
textList.text: It appears a merchant vessel is trying to sell their supplies off to other nearby ships. "Come on now, these are some fine goods! The Militia ain't got everything imaginable stuffed away in those armouries, you're gonna have to stock up from someone else too!"

A smuggler vessel quickly hails you. "Hey uh, we MEANT to travel back to our clan's territory but we... ended up here instead. I don't suppose you could by some of our goods so we have less contraband for those militiamen to catch us with?"
A supply depot for Militia ships hails you. "Normally we offer refuels to passing Militia vessels, but if you got some scrap I'm sure we could work out something for you as well!"

textList.name: EMPTY_MILITIA
textList.text: A small training exercise is going on nearby between several Militia ships. You feel it's best not to get involved.
You attempt to hail a small outpost nearby, but they decline your attempts at communication. You aren't too bothered by it, but you wish they hadn't been so rude.

Nothing but empty space here. Either there's something your missing, or the Militiamen didn't have anything worthwhile to install here. Either way, you won't be sticking around long enough for it to matter.

A pirate vessel flies past, but before you can react they are promptly followed by a Militia ship. The Militia ship is much faster though and swiftly catches the pirates and starts to make arrests. You try not to get involved and slip away.

textList.name: STORES_FED
textList.text: An automated Federation supply drone is stationed here. After scanning your ID, it identifies you as a Federation ship and opens up its automated store.
A large civilian market has been established in this system. Allied Federation ships patrol the area to make sure Rebels and Pirates can't sneak in.

A few damaged Federation ships nearby hail you. "Oh good, a friendly face. We took some damage from a Rebel attack, nothing major but we need scrap for repairs before we can reunite with our squadron. I don't suppose you'd want to trade?"
A Federation supply depot is set up on the nearby planet. They won't give anything away for free, but that doesn't mean they won't be open to trade.

textList.name: EMPTY_FED_NORMAL
textList.text: The wreckage of a single Federation ship drifts nearby. There's not much there left to salvage, and you feel dirty even considering scraping it.
This beacon is rather unremarkable. It must simply serve as a connection for passing ships.
The Federation has been hurting greatly in this reality, and this system is filled with many abandonded Federation structures. There doesn't appear to be anything worth scraping.
A few Federation and Civilian ships are passing through this system, but none will respond to your hails.

event.name: EMPTY_FED_FLEET
event.text: A few larger Federation ships float some distance away, but none respond to your hails.

textList.name: STORES_ENGI
textList.text: The Engi can do remarkable things with just a pile of scrap. The Engi hive at this beacon are selling equipment for just that.
A message arrives: "Your scrap, ours. Our weapons for you." You're about to raise the shields when you realize it's just an Engi trader looking for a trade.
An Engi ship hails: "Engine upgrade necessary for travel home. Sale of equipment necessary for Engine upgrade."

textList.name: EMPTY_ENGI
textList.text: The complex arrangements of ship hulls and FTL drive capacitors floating abandoned in space suggest the Engi were here not too long ago; but no longer.
You arrive at a green planet with great plains and rolling waterfalls. It would be of little interest to the Engi nearby.

You have arrived near an Engi construction yard. Most Engi maintain their bi-pedal appearance out of habit but here you see a number of Engi hives working together to create massive organic machines adept at building ships. Truly a sight to behold.

Even though each "individual" Engi is made up of trillions of nano-machines, their culture still revolves around traditional social interactions. A nearby station seems to be constructed for entertainment of passing Engi travellers.

You see a number of Engi space stations and fleets nearby. Despite looking like piles of junk loosely tied together they are actually a model of efficiency. They just lack a certain aesthetic emphasis in their constructions.
This system appears quite peaceful. You're not sure how long it'll last between the combined threats of the Rebels and Mantis.
There are a number of merchant ships passing through the area despite the threat of Mantis invasion. No doubt interested in buying the efficient technology of the Engi.
You see a small Rebel carrier in the distance. You lay low and try to blend in with the other traffic. However it's surprising to see a Rebel military ship alone deep in Engi space.
The Engi seem to have avoided this particular node, along with every other life-form. You keep your eyes peeled for reasons why, but spin up the FTL without event.
A cluster of Engi satellites in orbit of a nearby planet are the only clue the mechanical species was ever here. You have other places to be.

textList.name: STORES_HARMONY
textList.text: The Engi can do remarkable things with just a pile of scrap. The Engi hive at this beacon are selling equipment for just that.
A message arrives: "Your scrap, ours. Our weapons for you." You're about to raise the shields when you realize it's just an Engi trader looking for a trade.
An Engi ship hails: "Engine upgrade necessary for travel home. Sale of equipment necessary for Engine upgrade."

textList.name: EMPTY_HARMONY
textList.text: The complex arrangements of ship hulls and FTL drive capacitors floating abandoned in space suggest the Engi were here not too long ago; but no longer.
You arrive at a green planet with great plains and rolling waterfalls. It would be of little interest to the Engi nearby.

You have arrived near an Engi construction yard. Most Engi maintain their bi-pedal appearance out of habit but here you see a number of Engi hives working together to create massive organic machines adept at building ships. Truly a sight to behold.

Even though each "individual" Engi is made up of trillions of nano-machines, their culture still revolves around traditional social interactions. A nearby station seems to be constructed for entertainment of passing Engi travellers.

You see a number of Engi space stations and fleets nearby. Despite looking like piles of junk loosely tied together they are actually a model of efficiency. They just lack a certain aesthetic emphasis in their constructions.
This system appears quite peaceful. You're not sure how long it'll last between the combined threats of the Rebels and Mantis.
There are a number of merchant ships passing through the area despite the threat of Mantis invasion. No doubt interested in buying the efficient technology of the Engi.
You see a small Rebel carrier in the distance. You lay low and try to blend in with the other traffic. However it's surprising to see a Rebel military ship alone deep in Engi space.
The Engi seem to have avoided this particular node, along with every other life-form. You keep your eyes peeled for reasons why, but spin up the FTL without event.
A cluster of Engi satellites in orbit of a nearby planet are the only clue the mechanical species was ever here. You have other places to be.

textList.name: STORES_SEPERATIST
textList.text: A Separatist with an odd face formation, giving it the appearance of wearing a monocle and top hat, hails you. He offers you some goods.
Though Separatists tend to avoid strangers, the ship here is offering to trade with anyone passing through.
A trading ship, taking the chance to pass through this sector knowing he will recieve few opposition, notices you and offers to trade.

textList.name: EMPTY_SEPERATIST
textList.text: A cluster of nanobots floats nearby, but ignores your ship. It dissipates quickly, leaving you to your own devices.
Separatists Engi like to keep to themselves, and will usually avoid other ships. The Separatist nearby jumps away as soon as you approach.
You believe this beacon to be empty, though it's impossible to tell with all of the microscopic nanobots floating around in empty space.
Some space junk left over from what was presumably two Engi ships... merging. Unfortunately, none of it is worthy of salvaging.
Not an Engi ship in sight. You figure it's safe to do something on the ship

textList.name: STORES_ZOLTAN
textList.text: The Zoltan are fascinated by other species, and have set up something of an alien knick-knack shop here. Why not take a look?
A human ship hails: "My friends! Please, there is nothing I don't have, and there is nothing worth wanting that I can't get. Why not take a look around my shop?"
A Mantis crew here has hunkered down in the abdomen of a long-dead space-whale - the only way, presumably, for them to operate their black-market trade without detection. Worth a look?

textList.name: EMPTY_ZOLTAN
textList.text: There are some mineral-rich asteroids here that the Zoltan have left idle, but you've none of the necessary equipment to mine them.
You have to admit - Zoltan space is a beautiful and peaceful place indeed. However, re-engaging the FTL and finishing your mission is your priority, not sight-seeing.
A light asteroid field is entering the atmosphere of a nearby planet - a fireworks show on a galactic scale. There's little for it but to take in the ambience and program the next jump.
You stumble upon some Zoltan military vessels engaging in combat training. Their Energy Shields are impressive, but you note how quickly beam and ion weaponry take them down.
You don't have time to hail the Zoltan ship that was waiting at this beacon before it jumps away. They are a careful race.
A Zoltan shipyard is stationed at this beacon. You admire the display of hundreds of glowing Zoltan performing delicate exterior work on a massive transport ship.
A message broadcast from a nearby planet announces the presence of an ancient Zoltan monastery available for visiting. Likely just a tourist trap, but still too bad you don't have the time to visit.

textList.name: STORES_CAPITAL
textList.text: A Zoltan trading ship hails you. They offer a gander at their equipment and supplies.

The Zoltan and Rock governments have been on friendlier terms for longer than the Federation. A Rock trading ship soliciting goods to citizens hails you and wonders if you might be interested in what they are selling.
Despite the efforts of the Zoltan government, small black markets around the sector still manage to operate. It appears you have discovered one here.

textList.name: EMPTY_CAPITAL
textList.text: A group of Ministry ships are docked with a small station nearby. The chatter on the comms seems entirely political talk, and you decide not to intervene.
This beacon is bland and boring, similar to the typical political discussions between the citizens of this sector.
A vaguely interesting looking temple selling low priced souvenirs directs an advertisement towards your ship, but you quickly decline.
A Zoltan Peace Brigade is busy harassing a nearby star system for tax evasion. You decide not to get involved.
A Zoltan colony rests nearby, their Zoltan Shield online and weapons at maximum power. They clearly aren't interested in visitors.
A few pirate ships jump away as soon as you approach, leaving you to wonder what they were doing.

textList.name: STORES_MONK
textList.text: A merchant ship stops. "We accidentally travelled to this sector, only to find that the inhabitants have no need for military supplies. At least they're friendly, but business hasn't been great. I don't suppose there's anything you'd like?"

A civilian market has been set up at this beacon. "A traveler, welcome. I was permitted by the Monks to run my store here, as long as I welcome all visitors into my store. So come on in and take a gander at what we have to offer."
A Zoltan ship hails you. "Hello friend. We are on our path to enlightenment, but our master told us that we must rid of our weapons of war. Perhaps you would care to buy some?"
It seems a small market has been set up here, run by Slugs and smugglers. You're certain the Monks would disapprove, but their nonviolent ways prevent them from doing anything about it.

textList.name: EMPTY_MONK
textList.text: The ship computer informs you this beacon is considered sacred ground. You aren't sure why, because the beacon seems rather empty to you.
This beacon appears empty, other than the swirling nebulous gases. You wonder why the Zoltan Monks hide in these nebulas, and what they're hiding from.
Unlike other nebula sectors, you feel relatively safe in the thick gasses of these nebulas.
No ships can be found at this beacon. You can use this at a resting place.
This beacon is even more peaceful than the rest of the sector, with not a single ship to be found.

textList.name: STORES_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: A merchant hails you. "These... what are they called... yes, Duskbringers. They don't make good customers, more interested in raiding my warehouses 'looking for contraband' than buying my supplies. I don't suppose you would be interested in what I have to offer?"

Black markets in Zoltan sectors are exceptionally rare, even Duskbringer controlled ones. Still, the one here has been built into the side of a large asteroid, and they appear to be open to any sort of customers.

You assume the Zoltan merchant at this beacon must be selling to Duskbringers only, but surprisingly he hails you before you can fly away. "Greetings. Though protocol-S94-B states that I may not trade with Federation ships, I see no one around to enforce it. So please, come in."

textList.name: EMPTY_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: This beacon is too quiet. You're wary of a trick, but no ships appear. You relax, and focus on doing something on the ship.
The ruins of several ships are still here, but their bones have already been picked clean. You bet the Duskbringers had something to do with this.
A Zoltan brigade protects this beacon, a rare display of anti-Dusk measures being taken by the Zoltan government. They refuse to open communications with you.
The cold war between the Zoltans and Federation is responsible for the evolution of the Duskbringers. Luckily, none of their ships are present at this beacon.

textList.name: EMPTY_ORCHID
textList.text: Orchid space is famous for being calm and peaceful. This beacon exemplifies that, with no ships in sight.
This beacon serves as a connection. You notice how it is located very far from the local star. Probably a means of protection against solar flares considering the frail nature of the Orchids.
You arrive at a beacon located near a planet in process of terraforming to support plant life. There are no other ships around. You prepare to jump away.
This beacon is devoid of any activity at the moment. The star is too dim, providing insufficient energy for light-dependent flora.

textList.name: STORES_ORCHID
textList.text: This beacon is an Orchid trade hub. Even though most of their equipment is made of plant matter, Orchids find some use for scrap metal as well, and are willing to trade for it.
A giant Orchid trade station with military escort is located at the beacon. As you dock and enter the station, you can't help but notice how calm and silent it is inside.
A lone trading Orchid vessel awaits you at the beacon. Its crew sends you a simple message: "Military goods available for sale."

You stumble upon an Orchid trading station dealing with common goods made from organic materials originating from Orchid home planet. Learning that you represent Federation, Orchids agree to sell some military goods as well.

textList.name: STORES_CRYSTAL
textList.text: You arrive in an area bustling with Crystalline ships and stations. A merchant quickly messages you, "This is a great opportunity for both of us! Do you have anything you wish to sell or trade?"
"Ah! Hello aliens", says a rotund Crystalline being on the vid screen. "I hoped I would run into one of you. I am a collector of alien artifacts and hoped you would have some equipment to barter!"

You arrive at a trade depot and find a store that is willing to open communications with you. "I can't say I've traded with many of your kind before, but perhaps we could work out some sort of exchange."

You receive an incoming transmission, but it seems badly garbled. Eventually you realize it's advertising an equipment store. "Apologies," says the vendor, when you finally get him on the vid screen, "Long time since use universal translator no necessary. Please, buy, buy!"

textList.name: EMPTY_CRYSTAL
textList.text: As soon as you arrive, all of the ships docked at a nearby station scatter and jump while the station itself uses some form of cloak technology to disappear. They mustn't like outsiders here...

No ships are in range, so you take the time to scan the area. It seems like every planet you've seen so far shows signs of highly developed habitation without overpopulation. They must have a very structured and well regulated society.
There appears to be no one living near this node, a rare sight in this highly developed sector.

You arrive near a civilian settlement. It looks like their homes, ships and stations all rely heavily on an intriguing crystalline material. You wonder how they are able to create so much of this substance, and what benefits it will provide to the other races of the galaxy.
A few merchant ships pass nearby but they are either ignoring your hails or their computer hasn't yet been adjusted to work through the same frequencies...

textList.name: STORES_CRYSTALHOME
textList.text: Despite the unfriendly attitude from many of the inhabitants of the sector, it appears you've happened across a trader who doesn't care about who his client is - as long as they have scrap to spend.
It appears not all Crystals are unwilling to deal with outsiders. A merchant vessel nearby opens communications and requests to trade.

You receive a hail from a Crystalline vessel. "Outsiders? Look at your tiny ship... Haha!" You roll your eyes and prepare to leave when they hail you again. "Wait, wait, don't leave. This was merely me trying to set up a trade!"
A Rock station drifts nearby, with several other ships docked outside. Their captain greets you and welcomes you aboard to shop.

textList.name: STORES_PIRATE
textList.text: A few small ships are visible on the vidscreen, and you almost activate weapons targeting. However, sensors indicate they are simply honest merchants. The pirates must be making you jumpy. You message them asking about their wares.
You detect a hub of activity nearby. A large corporation has set up a trade depot and has a number of well armed ships patrolling. This appears to be a relatively safe place to get repairs.

You receive a wide-band automated message, "Welcome to our humble trade depot and shipyard! All are welcome, but try any funny business and our 152 automated turret satellites will tear your ship to shreds!"
A well armed transport ship and a squadron of fighters are in orbit nearby. You are wary of their trustworthiness but beggars can't be choosers.

textList.name: EMPTY_PIRATE
textList.text: As soon as you arrive, a small ship de-cloaks behind yours. You immediately power up the shields and weapons, but they continue on their trajectory unimpressed. You try to calm your nerves.
A small pirate ship messages you, "That sure is a shiny ship you got there." You fire a warning shot across their bow and they respond, "Hey! No need for violence! It was just a comment..."
The only thing within scanning range is an old abandoned mining structure and a resupply station. They appear to have been picked clean by marauders.

You arrive to have a small fleet of Engi ships target you with a message, "Piracy results in negative societal impact. Not permitted." You assure them of your honest intentions and they allow you to pass.

textList.name: STORES_BLACKMARKET
textList.text: A smuggler ship approaches, and you act on instinct, arming the weapons. "Woah woah, relax. We were going to offer you a trade, but not if you're going to have that kind of attitude!" You apologize and ask to see their wares.

It's odd to see so many different kinds of races here with so little conflict. You even pass a stray Rebel ship, whose captain gives you a glare but leaves you alone. You spot a store at this beacon, which must be the source of all these ships.
A rinky dink station here hails you. "Don't mind our appearance friend! We have many things to offer inside, care to take a look?"

You approach a populated planet carpeted in cities and bustling with ships moving to and fro. Dotted among the skyscrapers are a wide variety of merchant hubs, many which would be in violation of local laws were they actually enforced by the militia. Word of mouth in the city leads you to one such trader selling military equipment 'acquired' from the Rebels.

textList.name: EMPTY_BLACKMARKET
textList.text: This beacon is noticeable only because of how empty it is, a rarity in this busy sector.
Not one speck of purple or white paint in sight. You relax and consider this a much needed break.
A few ships here are trading, but none respond to your hails. Probably an illegal sale, you figure.
An abandoned trading port is here, probably due to little business. Upon further inspection, they were selling antique snow globes. Nothing worth taking.

textList.name: STORES_HACKED
textList.text: A hacker ship is preaching deals to nearby ships. "Federation, aye? No matter, sssso long asss you got ssome ssscrap, you're welcome here."

A civilian is running a small shop here. "The hackers have allowed me to run my store under their control, so long as 90% of the proceeds go to them. So please, buy as much as you can so I can afford food tonight."

event.name: STORES_HACKED_FAKE
event.text: There appears to be no store here after-all! A hacker ship here hails you. "Hahaha! You absssssolute fool! You nincompoop! You fell for my trap! Prepare to die."

textList.name: EMPTY_HACKED
textList.text: In this dangerous sector you can never be certain of anything, including the apparent emptiness of this beacon. After a few minutes pass and nothing bad happen, you begin to feel safe again.
This beacon is empty, something unexpected in a sector like this.
Deactivated civilian infrastructure drifts nearby. You're too wary of a potential trap to approach it, so you use this beacon as a welcome break instead.
A few civilian ships scatter as you approach. You're left alone at the beacon.
An empty beacon in a sector full of tricks such as this is suspicious, but nothing seems wrong about the nearby system.

textList.name: STORES_REBEL
textList.text: You discover a re-supply station used by Rebels and civilians alike. You transmit your fake ship identification and for once, they don't seem to recognize your ship. You try to assume the air of a local as you prepare to dock.
You arrive at a small space station that is putting out wide-band broadcasts on black-market channels. You doubt they would turn away any business, regardless of allegiances.
You receive generic advertisements from a nearby public ship-yard. It seems they are willing to work on any ship, not only those of Rebel hue.

textList.name: EMPTY_REBEL
textList.text: You enter a system bustling with Rebel activity. Supply freighters and re-supply stations are dwarfed by a few heavy warships. Luckily, no one seems to be paying attention to small cruisers. No ships are scanning or messaging you.

You arrive near a small Rebel refueling depot. Your ship is being scanned multiple times so they must recognize you, but there appears to be no combat-ready ships in the vicinity. The only message you receive is a denial to your request to dock at the depot.
There is not much of interest nearby. A small sun in the distance with a few orbiting planets in nearby space provide little of interest.

There are no other ships near this beacon, however you detect a small communication relay. You tap into it without a problem; there is no encryption. Most of the chatter revolves around troop and fleet movements, not particularly interesting.
There is a small planet nearby with scattered settlements. A small Rebel fleet is in orbit with many ships ferrying back and forth. It must be a more recently 'liberated' planet.

textList.name: STORES_JERRY
textList.text: You've come across a small civilian market with a large garden outside of it. The store owner welcomes you. "Ain't it wonderful? Jerry stopped by and planted all these himself! Now come on in, and we'll see if I can sell you some murder tools."
An outpost nearby is marketing services to all ships, including Federation and alien ones. This place sure seems friendly for a Rebel sector...
A Federation merchant ship flies past, but stops when they see you. "What the hell even is this place man? That guard just let me in and didn't even care! It's insane... but anyways, want to trade?"

textList.name: EMPTY_JERRY
textList.text: A stray balloon floats past, drifting aimlessly into the nothingness. How and why, you aren't sure, but this is why you should always hold on carefully.
In this surprisingly friendly sector, you've finally come across a beacon with nothing but silence.
There are no ships to be seen here, which is particuarly unusual in Rebel space. Where's all the murderous soldiers out to get your head?
A Rebel ship flies past, several cans tied to the back of the ship. They stop to watch your ship, but quickly jump away.

textList.name: STORES_REBELHOLD
textList.text: You discover a re-supply station used by Rebels and civilians alike. You transmit your fake ship identification and for once, they don't seem to recognize your ship. You try to assume the air of a local as you prepare to dock.
You arrive at a small space station that is putting out wide-band broadcasts on black-market channels. You doubt they would turn away any business, regardless of allegiances.
You receive generic advertisements from a nearby public ship-yard. It seems they are willing to work on any ship, not only those of Rebel hue.

textList.name: EMPTY_REBELHOLD
textList.text: You enter a system bustling with Rebel activity. Supply freighters and re-supply stations are dwarfed by a few heavy warships. Luckily, no one seems to be paying attention to small cruisers. No ships are scanning or messaging you.

You arrive near a small Rebel refuelling depot. Your ship is being scanned multiple times so they must recognize you, but there appears to be no combat-ready ships in the vicinity. The only message you receive is a denial to your request to dock at the depot.
There is not much of interest nearby. A small sun in the distance with a few orbiting planets in nearby space provide little of interest.

There are no other ships near this beacon, however you detect a small communication relay. You tap into it without a problem; there is no encryption. Most of the chatter revolves around troop and fleet movements, not particularly interesting.
There is a small planet nearby with scattered settlements. A small Rebel fleet is in orbit with many ships ferrying back and forth. It must be a more recently 'liberated' planet.

textList.name: EMPTY_AUTO
textList.text: An abandoned shipyard lays far in the distance. It doesn't appear to be worth salvaging.
The empty husk of what was once an Auto-ship drifts nearby, scrapped well beyond the point of return by pirates.
This beacon is suprisingly empty, one of the few beacons the Rebels have not yet ravaged with their Auto-tech.
It appears the automated expanse of the shipyard has not yet reached this beacon.
Other than some distant scaffolding at this beacon, it's void of anything of interest.

event.name: STORES_AUTO
event.text: An Auto-Vendor drone has been set up here. Luckily, it doesn't seem to identify you as hostile, and opens up its market to you.

textList.name: STORES_MANTIS
textList.text: Uncertain about what you'll discover at this beacon, you scan the surroundings. You detect several warnings on wide-band channels discouraging any violence in protected trade-space. Perhaps you can find some wares nearby.

Merchants are not highly respected among the Mantis race, so few undertake the profession. You're mildly surprised to receive an advertisement from a nearby space dock. You decide to see what they have to offer.
Identifying a Mantis trading post ahead, you signal them so that your approach won't be taken as a threat. The leader hails you: "You has scrap? Quickly, dock before warriors see you."

A struggling Mantis cargo ship headed for the node raises what's left of shields as you jump in. You power up your weapons as a show of force, and they reluctantly agree to offload some of their cargo to you - for a price.

The Rebels are already here! The crew braces for impact, but none comes. The sensors report the unmanned rebel supply ship is malfunctioning and is stuck in vending mode - for a little scrap you can take your pick.

textList.name: EMPTY_MANTIS
textList.text: At this point you almost expect a fight with the Mantis, but this beacon appears to be entirely devoid of other ships. You take the time to catch your breath and double check the ship's systems.
The only thing this beacon offers is a view of deep space and a brief respite from battles. For some this must be a welcome refuge.

A nearby Mantis mining operation is clearly using heavy Engi slave labor. You briefly consider the possibility of emancipating the slaves, but the Mantis presence is too formidable. You decide to lay low.
There aren't so many parts of Mantis space that aren't dotted by the wrecks of battles past, but this is one of them. You take a deep breath and prepare to move on.
There's nothing here but space debris and some uninhabitable planetoids.
You fancy you see something moving in the shadow of the beacon, but all remains still.

textList.name: STORES_MANTIS_HIVE
textList.text: Uncertain about what you'll discover at this beacon, you scan the surroundings. You detect several warnings on wide-band channels discouraging any violence in protected trade-space. Perhaps you can find some wares nearby.

Merchants are not highly respected among the Mantis race, so few undertake the profession. You're mildly surprised to receive an advertisement from a nearby space dock. You decide to see what they have to offer.
Identifying a Mantis trading post ahead, you signal them so that your approach won't be taken as a threat. The leader hails you: "You have scrap? Quickly, come dock before the warriors see you."

A struggling Mantis cargo ship headed for the node raises what's left of shields as you jump in. You power up your weapons as a show of force, and they reluctantly agree to offload some of their cargo to you - for a price.

The Rebels are already here! The crew braces for impact, but none comes. The sensors report the unmanned rebel supply ship is malfunctioning and is stuck in vending mode - for a little scrap you can take your pick.

textList.name: EMPTY_MANTIS_HIVE
textList.text: At this point you almost expect a fight with the Mantis, but this beacon appears to be entirely devoid of other ships. You take the time to catch your breath and double check the ship's systems.
The only thing this beacon offers is a view of deep space and a brief respite from battles. For some this must be a welcome refuge.

A nearby Mantis mining operation is clearly using heavy Engi slave labor. You briefly consider the possibility of emancipating the slaves, but the Mantis presence is too formidable. You decide to lay low.
There aren't so many parts of Mantis space that aren't dotted by the wrecks of battles past, but this is one of them. You take a deep breath and prepare to move on.
There's nothing here but space debris and some uninhabitable planetoids.
You fancy you see something moving in the shadow of the beacon, but all remains still.

textList.name: STORES_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: Though regular Hive Mantis aren't too eager to trade with outsiders, the Free Mantis welcome visitors, so long as they pose no threat to their clan's safety. You do a quick check to make sure your weapons are powered down before asking to strike up a trade.

A hollowed space whale carcass floats nearby, and naturally you assume it hosts a Mantis market. However as you approach, you catch a Free Mantis ship watching you. "Hahahah, no Mantis in whale. However, we are willing trade, if you wish."

To your antonishment, the Free Mantis ship at this beacon hails you before you can hail them. "Humans keep running, before we can welcome them. All we want is to sell excess supplies. Are you willing?"
A civilian station has been established at this beacon, and an automated message welcomes you to come inside and trade.

textList.name: EMPTY_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: A Free Mantis clan lays inactive nearby. You approach, but they hail you with a warning to stay away. You figure its best to abide their wishes.
There is no sign of any permanent habitation near this beacon, only a lone Free mantis ship that jumps away before you have the chance to hail.
The occasional space junk flies by, but nothing worth for even firing from a flak cannon.
There are no ships in sight, not even of the Free Mantis. We have some time to spend to ourselves.

textList.name: STORES_ROCK
textList.text: You cross paths with a Rock ship returning from a rare diplomatic mission. Equally surprising, the captain responds to your hails and agrees to a mutual trade.
You come across a Rock trading post. It's rare they deal with outsiders, but they need to sell the last of their stock, and will pay their dues for their transgression when they return home.
With the local Rock settlements so unwilling to trade with other life forms, an opportunistic Mantis crew has postponed its piracy activities and set up shop to catch any passing trade.
The Rock tolerate few aliens in their space, but even they seem to respect the wisdom of the Zoltan - a few of them have established a trading post in the husk of an abandoned capital ship.
You receive a hail on Federation frequencies: "You're Federation?! We- we weren't sure we'd ever see a friendly face again. There's little business here, perhaps you'd like to trade?"

textList.name: EMPTY_ROCK
textList.text: You receive a message meant to degrade you as aliens. You half expect an attack but it seems to have come from a small civilian shuttle.
No one bothers your ship as you float among numerous space stations and mining platforms. The Rock certainly run efficient operations.

You arrive and detect signs of battle. A few ships are taking passes at each other near a small station. You don't know if it's a territory issue, a contest or a rite of passage but you decide it's best to stay out of it.
There's not much at this beacon. Just a few abandoned depots, stripped clean.
A few freighters pass by but they refuse all communications. Must not want to sully their reputation by talking with foreigners.
You see a small trading post and ask about refuelling but they respond, "Go away! We don't serve your kind here."
You see a Zoltan merchant and ask about his wares. He responds, "Sorry, but it took years to gain their trust. I can't be seen communicating with you. I hope you understand." He cuts communications.

textList.name: STORES_ROCKHOME
textList.text: A ship filled with Rock outcasts hails you. "The Elders are eager to punish us for our 'crimes', and i'm sure the same goes in regards to you. So how about a trade, since we find ourselves in such a similar predicament?"
A trader hails you. "The Rockmen are... interesting clients. Perhaps it would be of benefit if I diversify my clientle... Are you in need of some supplies?"
It seems a small Rock trading station is operating here. Surprisingly, it claims to be open to ships of all sorts, regardless of their origins.

The Rock Homeworlds are a dangerous sector, but luckily you see a friendly face every now and then. An Engi vessel simply passing through opens comms on a Federation channel and offers to 'initiate mutual transfer of goods'.

textList.name: EMPTY_ROCKHOME
textList.text: The Rock Elders keep a very strict eye on all of their systems. It seems their authoritarian ways have had a very negative effect on the nearby system, because there isn't a single ship roaming about.
Despite your very presence in this sector being a crime, no Rock ships stop you. A few civilians linger before jumping away, but you are undisturbed.
It's a miracle to find an empty beacon here, one free from the brutal enforcers who patrol this sector and the ever hostile citizens.

You can't remember many tales of the Rock Inquisition from Universe 0, but you're sure just a horribly violent war had terrible causalities on the Rock population. This beacon is unnervingly empty of all life, and you can only wonder if it is a consequence of the warmongering of the Elders' pre-Federation years.
A Rock patrol orbits around the beacon, but luckily they seem rather laid back. They hail you, "we won't tell if you don't either."
A Rock settlement lays far in the distance, but they refuse to respond to any hails. This beacon may as well be empty, because nothing can counter the stubbornness of the Rockmen.

textList.name: STORES_LOSTSUN
textList.text: A Lost Sun ship is trading military goods to nearby ships. They hail you. "No better defense than to put weapons in the hands of the commonwealth. You are not one of us, but you look like you could use some gear."
A civilian ship hails you. "We were heading through this sector, but that damn guard nearly killed us. We got away, but our defenses were compromised. We need money for repairs."

A Federation transport is passing by and spots you. "We're supposed to drop off some supplies for these brutes, but it's not a very satisfactory job. I'll be damned if I have another customer who goes about spewing their manifesto on the way the galaxy should be governed. I don't suppose you're willing to take some of our supplies off of our hands so we can leave this hell-hole any quicker?"

textList.name: EMPTY_LOSTSUN
textList.text: A few Lost Sun fortifications are scattered about, but none contact you. You take this time to rest.
You are greeted by nothing more than an unusual break in the usual busy wartime acitvities of this sector.
A nearby Lost Sun station cloaks as soon as you jump in. You take the message and fly away until you're alone.

textList.name: STORES_SLUG
textList.text: A huge Slug teleports from nowhere onto the bridge! Before you can open fire, he's spread his wares across the helm and is brandishing things at you.

You cautiously approach a Slug colony on a huge asteroid. It's a brave person who sets foot on a Slug planet - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.
Slugs are very relaxed when it comes to enforcing anti-piracy laws, if they even enforce them at all. A busy black market in operation here.
Slugs might be shady tricksters, but a small show of your force convinced the Slug merchants here not to mess with you, and let you browse their wares freely.
You're hailed by Civilian merchants. "Good, someone we can trust. We keep getting tricked by these damn Slugs, so we hope you'll be a much more friendly client."

textList.name: EMPTY_SLUG
textList.text: You arrive at the beacon and are relieved at the sight of open space. Nebulas are terribly claustrophobic.
This beacon marks a 'small' gap in the nebula. No colonies or ships in scanning distance.
You are relieved to see your sensors blink back on after the jump. No ships detected.
The Slugs rely heavily on their telepathic powers and are reluctant to give up that advantage by extending beyond nebulas. It's unlikely you'll encounter any this far from the clouds.
You arrive in an area clear of nebula and quickly check to see if the sensors are working. Everything is fine and no ships are detected in the vicinity.

textList.name: NEBULA_EMPTY_SLUG
textList.text: When it comes to Slugs, no news is not necessarily good news. However, if they are watching, they don't seem to want to confront you.
It's not unusual to feel paranoia in a Slug controlled nebula, but for once, it is unfounded.
Either this part of Slug space is deserted, or it's too dense for even Slugs to detect your presence. Time to move.
This area of the nebula seems entirely empty until a small Slug transport and its escorts emerges suddenly from through the clouds, only to disappear again in a matter of seconds.

You explore around the beacon and are shocked when a rock the size of a small moon suddenly looms ahead of you. Scans reveal the solid-looking rock is just a husk, almost entirely mined out of useful minerals.

There are a number of small stations for travellers in the area, lit up by guiding lights and advertisements. Only Slug ships are docked so you decide it's better to avoid a confrontation and steer clear.

event.name: STORES_CLAN
event.text: It seems the Guild has set up a store further away from the nebula, likely to draw in traffic from the tourists not so accustomed to the nebulous terrain.

textList.name: STORES_CLAN
textList.text: "Ay! Ay you! Ova 'ere! I got- *hiccup* I got ssstuff! You like ssstuff, right? Yeah!" A drunken Clansman offers some goods to you from aboard his ship.

A Guild lodge is offering many various items. While most have no interest to you like stolen organs or water bottles made out of the teeth of various species, there are some military goods on sale for you to take a look at.
A small market has been set up nearby by some Slugs. While everything about it screams 'health and safety code violation', it looks like they have some goods that might be of use to you.

textList.name: STORES_SHELL
textList.text: Shells are fascinated by science, but they often struggle to fund their endeavours. A prospective biologist has set up a small market selling military goods for scrap.
Shells might not be as greedy as their Slug cousins, but that doesn't mean they aren't willing to buckle down and sell some junk for a profit.
Though Shells are usually timid in nature, the merchant ship here makes no attempt to flee. Instead, they show you their wares.
A gathering of ships have collected around a small Shell station selling off some military goods. Might be worth a look.

textList.name: EMPTY_SHELL
textList.text: You arrive at the beacon and are relieved at the sight of open space. Nebulas are terribly claustrophobic.
This beacon marks a 'small' gap in the nebula. No colonies or ships in scanning distance.
You are relieved to see your sensors blink back on after the jump. No ships detected.
You arrive in an area clear of nebula and quickly check to see if the sensors are working. Everything is fine and no ships are detected in the vicinity.

textList.name: NEBULA_EMPTY_SHELL
textList.text: Shell space isn't quite as calm as you expected, but it's always nice to see a break from the other ships here.
You catch a brief glimpse of a Shell ship before it disappears into the nebula, but you doubt you'd be able to catch up with them. The beacon is otherwise empty.
No ships, not even of Shell origin, inhabit this beacon.
Shell space isn't too developed compared to many other regions, so it's not too unsurprising to find empty beacons such as this.
Much of Shell space has been closed off to be used for scientific purposes. You aren't sure what those purposes are, but your computer won't give any more information. Still, no one bothers you here.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead you quickly salvage what you can.

event.text: You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.
You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.

textList.name: TEXT_STORE_MORPH_HOSTILE
textList.text: You didn't think you'd be seeing Morph ships acting quite aggressive as this... it appears a Morph is attacking a small Shell merchant ship!
You recieve a hail from a distant Federation supply vessel. "Help, I think I accidentally angered the blob things! I don't know what they're saying but they're really scaring me man!"
"OOG! URP UPR TAGLE SPACK!" A ship full of Morphs begin to chant as they circle around a merchant ship. Looks like they could use some help.

textList.name: STORES_COALITION
textList.text: You are surprised to see a Rebel ship stranded in this space. Rather than attacking, they offer to trade with you.
You find a black market being run at this beacon. Knowing the Coalition, they probably don't mind the opperation. Hopefully they wont mind you shopping here either.
The Coalition has been bad for trade in this sector. However, you find a few traders who seem to be doing well despite the war.
A large market is set up here. You avoid the few Coalition patrols around the area and get to the market undisturbed.

textList.name: EMPTY_COALITION
textList.text: The wrecks of a few Federation ships float nearby, but nothing appears salvageable. It appears a battle just happened here, but whatever happened to the other ships involved you don't know.
The only thing this beacon offers is a view of deep space and a brief respite from battles. For some this must be a welcome refuge.

You jump out of your seat when you see there is another Coalition ship nearby. However, rather than raising their weapons, they slip away. It appears they want to avoid you as much as you want to avoid them.
You find the area around the beacon to be rather empty. This might be a good place to take a break and relax.

textList.name: TEXT_NEBULA_EMPTY_COALITION
textList.text: No ships can be found in this nebula, a surprisingly unexpected outcome in this dangerous sector.
This nebula beacon is void of any ships, thankfully including Coalition ones.
The empty nebula here is far more concerning than relieving, but no ships approach from the clouds.

textList.name: TEXT_NEBULA_STORES_COALITION
textList.text: You are surprised to see a Rebel ship stranded in this space. Rather than attacking, they offer to trade with you.
You find a black market being run at this beacon. Knowing the Coalition, they probably don't mind the opperation. Hopefully they wont mind you shopping here either.
The Coalition has been bad for trade in this sector. However, you find a few traders who seem to be doing well despite the war.
A large market is set up here. You avoid the few Coalition patrols around the area and get to the market undisturbed.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead you quickly salvage what you can.

event.name: STORE_HOSTILE_SPIDER
event.text: This beacon greets you with a bizarre sight, a Militia ship firing on a Civilian market. However, you realize the issue when scans return showing the Militia ship to be infested by spiders!
You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the ship remain oblivious to your presence.

textList.name: STORES_SPIDER
textList.text: A Mantis shakes his claws at you, several metal ornaments dangling from them. "This store, blessed! Brilliant cycle has occurred, first spider kill human, then I kill spider! Come in, and buy human old supplies."
A civilian merchant vessel is selling supplies here. "It is the end of the world! Come on in and buy your apocalypse preparation equipment, before our new spider overlords kill us all."

A gruff looking Rockman in a Militia uniform is operating a refueling station also selling military goods nearby. "Haha, spiders would not dare disturb my might fortress, lest they deal with my arsenal of missiles. Be assured, this is a safe haven from the infestation!"
It seems a confident Orchid merchant is operating a store here. They must not be afraid of the usually carnivorous spiders, though you wouldn't be so sure...

textList.name: EMPTY_SPIDER
textList.text: A Militia squadron is clearing out several civilian vessels from the beacon. They attempt to do the same to you, but when you show your ID they leave you alone.
An abandoned station has been left behind at this beacon. You briefly consider scrapping it until you realize their automated defense system is still online. Best to ignore it...
The spider infestation has done a good number on this sector. Most of the civilians have already evacuated, leaving much of the sector empty, such as this beacon.
A refugee ship flies past. You're cautious, wondering if they might be infested, but the ship makes no attempt to contact you and jumps away.

textList.name: STORES_DYNASTY
textList.text: It appears a small rogue planet is drifting through the system here. To you, it looks uninhabitable, but it looks like the Dynasty has set up a market on the surface, accompanied by a convenient artificial atmosphere for the aerobic visitors.
A small market station orbits the nearby beacon. Must be some Dynasty shop, and luckily they don't have any hostile regards for selling to you.
"It is never safe with the demons lurking about! Come and buy!" Plays a tune over your radio in several languages. Looks like a Dynasty market is nearby.

The Dynasty's massive military force requires an impressive amount of funding to function. To raise this money, the Dynasty has set up many stores like this one to give away goods they no longer need.

"It ain't safe in Dynasty space, you oughtta know that if you're Federation. Come on in, I got some goods for ya'" A pirate ship beckons for you to approach. Normally you'd be skeptical, but something about them seems trustworthy.

event.name: STORES_GHOST
event.text: A refuge from the nebulas and other unknown horrors of this sector, a market has been set up at this beacon. Evidently, they've been having horrible business, and eagerly welcome you.

textList.name: NEBULA_EMPTY_GHOST_LIST
textList.text: You can't see anything through the thick gases surrounding your ship. Without knowing what is out there, all you can do is wait for your FTL to charge.
Without active sensors you have no other option but to look out of the view-ports in apprehension. It's eerily quiet.
As you wait for the FTL drive to charge, you half expect to be ambushed at any moment. However, no attack comes...
You feel naked without functioning sensors. You half expect a Rebel ship to appear from behind a cloud at any moment, but none come.
Your crew are constantly looking out of the windows, checking for hostiles. They jump at every creak and moan of the ship. The tension is almost palpable...
You nervously glance out the windows but the only thing to greet you is more clouds and silence.
You cycle through wide-band comm channels as soon as you arrive. Nothing but static.
With the sensors down, you spend a good deal of time staring out the window. It is, you must admit, rather beautiful here.
There's nothing here, save for vast swirls of gas reflecting rays from a distant sun.
The swarms of Ghosts haunting this sector have put you on edge, but no ship comes. You're alone, for now.
You watch the nebulous gasses drift around outside. No Ghosts or other ships to be seen, and you figure it's safe to say no one else is here.
You swear you see part of a ship poking out from the clouds before it slips away, but if it were real, it's gone now. No-one appears. You must be going insane.

event.name: EMPTY_GHOST
event.text: At last, a break from both the nebula and constant attacks from Ghosts.

textList.name: STORES_LANIUS
textList.text: A Federation ship hails you, offering to strike a trade. "I didn't expect such an aggressive 'welcome' from the Lanius, and our engines are shot. We could use some scrap for repairs."

You arrive to discover a number of Lanius ships docked at what appears to be a station. You hasten to leave but are relieved when they message you in your language. "Buy? Sell? Traders." It seems not all Lanius are unfriendly to strangers.
A rather bold merchant ship has established a store here. "I ain't scared of no metal men! These guys lost their rights to this land after they fell asleep. Come on in and buy some stuff!"
It's unusual to see a Lanius operated store here, but you suppose they have to make a living too. They aren't complete savages after-all.

textList.name: EMPTY_LANIUS
textList.text: You pass a civilian ship that warns of the nearby Lanius. "One of them attacked a civilian transport and started to melt their hull. But then the weirdest thing happened... another metal ship actually fired on its companion until it backed off." Apparently there are disagreements among the Lanius about what should be salvaged.
A few Lanius military ships are settled nearby, but they refuse all hails. Not wanting to mess with so many deadly ships at once, you leave them alone.
The ruins of an ancient Lanius settlement drift nearby, but you don't risk scrapping it for fear of angering any potential Lanius witnesses.
This beacon is rather peaceful. In the distance is a shiny Lanius city, a stunning sight even from orbit, but not one you care to interact with.

The raiding of this sector during the Lanius hibernation made this sector a massive site of traffic, but after the Lanius awoke and began attack civilians with reckless abandon, the number of visitors plummeted and the sector return to its original state of relative obscurity.

textList.name: STORES_AUG
textList.text: An augmented Lanius hails you as soon as you arrive. "Too many goods. Need selling them. You will buy?"

A damaged and partially melted Auto-vendor is stuck in selling mode and is attempting to distribute goods to any ships that come by. Unfortunately its services aren't free, but at least it doesn't care you're Federation.

textList.name: EMPTY_AUG
textList.text: Despite the usual clusters of ruins or Lanius you expect to find here, this beacon holds nothing more than a break from combat.
A few wrecks float nearby, but they've been picked completely dry. These ancient beings must have been prolific builders to have left so much behind...

textList.name: STORES_ABANDONED
textList.text: A large transport ship undergoing maintenance hails you. "Greetings, friend. We're getting out of this sector as soon as this Coolant Shaft is fixed and I suggest you do the same. I half expect a pirate to come barrelling down on us any second, or a Lanius to come along and melt us. We're trying to offload some inventory - interested in buying something?"

A trading depot is set up near the beacon. A surprising number of military ships guard the station. You pick up an advertisement on a wide band channel, "Ship parts, repairs, refueling, souvenirs - we got it all. Check out the only store not afraid of scavengers this side of Omacron 6."
You arrive at an empty space station, no doubt abandoned after all of the combat. Life signatures are detected at the ship depot and you spot a few crude signs stating "Everything Must Go!"

This beacon is bustling with activity. It looks like some merchants decided to capitalize on the fact that dozens of refugee ships are using this location to recharge their FTL drives. You browse their wares.
Despite this sector being primarily abandoned, every now and then travelling merchants will use this sector in their path to the destination. One such ship is passing through and offers to trade.
A pirate vessel hails you. You reluctantly respond and find they're looking to sell some goods that they recently 'borrowed' from an abandoned mining colony.

textList.name: EMPTY_ABANDONED
textList.text: The charts indicate this was the location of a small skirmish over a military facility on a nearby moon. Oddly, scans pick up no signs of debris from either the battle or the station. Yet another area sucked dry by scavengers.
Scans show no signs of any ships or settlements nearby. You have no way of knowing if the area was always uninhabited or if it was simply erased by scavengers.
This beacon is void of Lanius, Ghosts, pirates, or any other ship for that matter.
The charred remains of a civilian settlement suggests either recent pirate activity or a long ago battle with presumably Rebel forces. Either way, the beacon is now empty.

textList.name: STORES_NEBULA_CLEARING
textList.text: This beacon is a welcome break from the dense nebulas of the sector. It also appears a store has been established here.
A trading ship, having managed to find their way out of the nebula, welcomes you and offers to sell you some supplies.
Nebula sectors aren't usually great places to host a store, but at the very least the one here has wisely decided to do so outside of the clouds.

event.text: The store owners oblige and pay you some scrap.

textList.name: NEBULA_STORES
textList.text: Some brave entrepreneurs set up a station here to extract elements from the nebula. There seems to be a public shipyard and rest stop here as well.
Seeing a trade depot set up near the beacon implies there is an alien settlement on some nearby rock. You decide to check out their wares.
The centre of a hydrogen cloud doesn't seem like a very usual place for a store, but the Engi aren't a usual species. Wouldn't hurt to take a look.
An Engi cargo vessel hails: "Propose mutually beneficial exchange of properties." That smells like a bargain.

You discover a cluster of Federation refugee ships taking shelter in the folds of the nebula. "I'm sorry we've got nothing to give you, but we need scrap to keep the engines running." You sense they'll strike a trade.

textList.name: TEXT_NEBULA_NOTHING
textList.text: You can't see anything through the thick gases surrounding your ship. Without knowing what is out there, all you can do is wait for your FTL to charge.
Without active sensors you have no other option but to look out of the view-ports in apprehension. It's eerily quiet.
As you wait for the FTL drive to charge, you half expect to be ambushed at any moment. However, no attack comes...
You feel naked without functioning sensors. You half expect a Rebel ship to appear from behind a cloud at any moment, but none come.
Your crew are constantly looking out of the windows, checking for hostiles. They jump at every creak and moan of the ship. The tension is almost palpable...
You nervously glance out the windows but the only thing to greet you is more clouds and silence.
You cycle through wide-band comm channels as soon as you arrive. Nothing but static.
With the sensors down, you spend a good deal of time staring out the window. It is, you must admit, rather beautiful here.
There's nothing here, save for vast swirls of gas reflecting rays from a distant sun.

textList.name: TEXT_ABYSS_EMPTY_NEBULA
textList.text: The darkness of the nebula consumes your ship. There is nothing here but the gasses that drift around you.
The nebula around you is silent. You can hear every creak or thud on the ship.
The nebula appears to be the only other thing this beacon features. No other ships are in sight.

textList.name: TEXT_ABYSS_EMPTY
textList.text: As you stare into the endless abyss onwards, it's incredible to think this sector has always been here, free from traffic or space pollution for so long.
It's a mystery as to how these beacons got here, considering how empty this sector is.

textList.name: STORES_ORIGINS
textList.text: Surprisingly, it seems these Cultists have a considerably well established economy among each other. A busy store front is swarming with cultists, but they don't seem to mind selling to you either.
A small market run out of the skeleton of an old Crystalline vessel is in operation here.
A lost merchant ship hails you, requesting to trade so that they can pay off their debt to the Cultists and leave.

textList.name: EMPTY_ORIGINS
textList.text: Around you are the remains of a long-abandoned Crystalline society. You wish you could have seen what this sector was like before the Cultist invasion...
No ships are in view. You suppose this is how the Crystalline people would have preferred their sector stayed...
This beacon has not yet been touched by the swarms of invasive cultists. It should serve as a well earned break.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you quickly salvage what you can.

event.name: STORE_HOSTILE_ANCIENT
event.text: A nearby Ancient merchant appears to be registered as part of Aenwithe's resistance! However, it is currently under attack from an Auto-ship. Shall we assist?
You prepare for combat.
Fortunately the Auto-ship remain oblivious to your presence.

event.name: STORE_HOSTILE_ANCIENT_WIN
event.text: You have rescued the merchant from the Auto-ship. "You have my thanks, mortal creature. Accept this as gratitude. Now, do you care to trade?"

event.name: STORES_ANCIENT
event.text: You have found an Ancient ship who's translator is capable of speaking in your language. "Strangers, this is most unorthodox. Still, while you are at this beacon you are welcome. Come in, and shop."

textList.name: EMPTY_ANCIENT
textList.text: Three artificial planets, heavily damaged, float in the distance. They are void of a star to orbit, and some day they will crash into each other, but for now this beacon is safe.

You must admit, you've grown used to the polution caused by frequent ship battles outside of this sector. The clean space around you puts you at ease, and you figure its ok to do something aboard the ship.
An Ancient settlement has been established on the nearby artificial planet. It looks very well protected, and you decide its best to be left alone.
Not an Ancient ship to be seen. You're surprised how busy this sector has been considering the Ancients are supposedly close to extinction, but you're happy to take a break.

textList.name: STORES_ROYAL
textList.text: A resistance ship hails Aenwithe, who patches them through to the rest of the ship. "That Rebel attack was insane! I'm glad you made it out alright. We have some extra supplies left over, but we're low on scrap. Care to trade?"
You've found a small Ancient cargo ship in the same system as you. You assume they'll turn hostile or insult you, but instead they offer to trade!

A small Ancient Research station is orbiting a moon. As you pass by, they offer you a unique deal. "Usually, we just kill people and study their corpses, but with so many filthy humans entering this sector we'll have boat loads of people to study. So instead, would you like to trade?"

For some reason, broken Auto-vendors seem to find their way into every quadrant of the galaxy, including this one. A malfunctioning Auto-ship falsely registers your vessel as Rebel-owned, and offers some wares.
